TopicTitle: A little help with editing, please...SaurKraut Legion

Articles.Content:
I'm beginning a machinima series using Kerbal Space Program, and based off of some earlier "dramatic" episodes I filmed for a psuedo-LP. I've decided to go full-scale machinima, using voice acting and advanced video/audio editing techniques/software.

Here's a link to the intro video I've compiled:

I currently use FRAPS (full version), Cyberlink PowerDirector Ultra 12, and Cyberlink ColorDirector 2.

Some questions I have/areas of assistance I need:

1. How to animate Kerbals (Kerbalizer doesn't give me what I need lol) in the manner similar to that which has been done by Squad.

2. Is there a way to change textures on parts (or put on decals, there used to be but I can't find it on the Spaceport anymore)?

3. Is there an easier way to change Kerbals' appearances other than painstaking frame-by-frame motion tracking and color replacement? I mean individual Kerbals, not just retexturing globally.

4. Is there another filming mod out there that can do better than KerbalCam (not that KerbalCam isn't great--it is--just looking for alternatives)?

I'm pretty good with computers, but don't know how to code very well (except HTML), so please break it down Barney style. Thank you!

*Edit* - I found Blender...downloading now...what I must discover for myself, I guess, is how complicated it's going to be. Also, can one insert his new models made in blender into KSP itself?
